lead_paragraph: Amid tributes to a Spanish player who died and to victims of the Greek wildfires, Sevilla routed host AEK Athens, 4-1, to reach the group stage of the European Champions League yesterday.The game originally was scheduled for last week but was postponed when Sevilla midfielder Antonio Puerta died Aug. 28 after collapsing during a game three days earlier. AEK had also requested a postponement because of wildfires in southern Greece that killed 65 people and caused a national state of emergency.
